timeline.bodyText: Seeing the same jobID here too - #17234 (comment)

replies.bodyText: Leave the comment over there.
replies.author: mssfang

timeline.bodyText: Why was this changed to non-primitive?
timeline.author: samvaity

replies.bodyText: It should be Object Boolean instead of primitive boolean, leave the default value to serivce.  service endpoint takes Boolean.
replies.author: mssfang
samvaity

replies.bodyText:
The explored parameter is primitive boolean. If user has option as null, we are using the null for the default value.
https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/pull/17267/files#diff-5ec2c21f81551de87633be791778c4b0897048d1148892267fa4bf442c44db38R123
replies.author: mssfang

timeline.bodyText: Is this still a service bug?
timeline.author: samvaity

replies.bodyText: Consider adding service bugs to issues for better follow up.
replies.author: samvaity

replies.bodyText: Yes, it is still a bugs. #17564
replies.author: mssfang

timeline.bodyText: Is this still true?
timeline.author: samvaity

replies.bodyText: Noop. They already corrected now
replies.author: mssfang

timeline.bodyText: by default, options.getPollInterval() ==> DEFAULT_POLL_INTERVAL, so if options is null, we use the defaultValue, if options is not null we use custom polling interval if user has set it, otherwise, use the DEFAULT_POLL_INTERVAL.
timeline.author: mssfang

replies.bodyText: This could be better done at the central place at options level  like here - https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/formrecognizer/azure-ai-formrecognizer/src/main/java/com/azure/ai/formrecognizer/models/RecognizeContentOptions.java#L60
replies.author: samvaity

replies.bodyText:
It is already there: https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/pull/17267/files#diff-659663d93baf5cac89b0841764fb0a0999f5461346bce5cc25fa1f8e4e0a2137R136
This check has a different purpose.  If 'options' is null, we are using DEFAULT_POLL_INTERVAL,  otherwise, we use what user defined custom poll interval. If user does not set any value, the pollInterval is still  DEFAULT_POLL_INTERVAL
replies.author: mssfang
